TextAsset.value: Then I’d have known that instead.
Okay, so what’s this stakeout stuff?
We don’t have much time before detention is up.
We’ll have to skip school to track this target and get to the bottom of the Big Conspiracy.
Sk-skip? I thought we were just gonna watch a guy and take some notes.
This must be a pretty big conspiracy then.
But it’s big. Super big maybe.
(I can’t believe we’re risking a black mark on our permanent records for a conspiracy that might not be big.)
Our target today is ordinary student ALFONSO “AL” B. TROSS. He’s always meeting sinister characters in this joint.
Honestly? I’m assuming they’re sinister because they look so normal.
If he’s meeting ordinary people, and then if HE’S so ordinary, then why is he worth tracking?
And if you think about it, that makes him EXTRAORDINARY.
And that’s not even counting the stuff that makes him WEIRD.
EXAMPLE! Consider that his name, Al B. Tross, is ODDLY SIMILAR to the name of a student who graduated last year, Agent Albatross.
(But, I mean, sometimes names sound similar. Like Tim or Jim!)
The most logical conclusion we can draw is that Al B. Tross is a secret agent of the big crazy conspiracy.
Probably the top agent. Maybe the king of the conspiracy!
Wouldn’t the MOST logical conclusion be that there isn’t a conspiracy?
Ha! You and I must have very different interpretation of the word “logical.”
Y’know, I’ve been thinking, there might be a better use of your life than chasing conspiracies like this.
Uh, hm. Something else? Something less creepy, maybe!
I really enjoy determining the strengths and weaknesses of everyone I meet to better fit them into the complicated web of conspiracies that make up Great Big Conspiracy.
You can’t use literally the thing I’m trying to get you to stop doing as an alternative hobby for the thing I’m trying to get you to stop doing!
(That can’t be all there is so this guy.)
I like doing stuff as totally fast as possible.
It’s the most efficient use of our limited time here on this world.
(I mean, it’s totally weird. But he’s kinda not wrong about it?)
(But, no, it’s totally weird to be thinking about it all the time.)
(Is that REALLY all there is to Richard?)
(Just being weird and paranoid and good looking.)
They say I’m pretty good at it.
Cooking, huh? Yeah. That’s definitely productive and not weird.
It comes pretty natural, I guess.
On my first day in Home Ec I figured out how to make a 3 minute egg in 45 seconds.
That’s an “A” Rank on the time trial.
You could maybe try to cook like, uh, normal?
Like, you don’t have to rush around at full speed and high alert all the time!
Hm? Eh, yeah cooking is okay.
If you’re into preparing food while under the oppressive thumb of a massive shadow government operating through an even shadowier puppetmaster, then yeah.
And Al B. Tross is part of this thing?
Okay. Which part though? The shadow government or the shadowier puppet thing?
That’s what we’re here to find out.
But don’t LOOK like you’re acting natural.
(But now that I’m thinking about acting natural, EVERYTHING I THINK AND DO FEELS WAY UNNATURAL!)
I was acting natural until you said to act natural and now I don’t know how to act!
Now that you’ve got me thinking about it I can’t act natural either!
(Argh, did I screw up the whole thing before it even started???)
Acting natural is just a kind of timing. We can do this, ${slot:playerName}! Using TOTAL CONCENTRATION!
(Wait, maybe that’s what acting natural looks like!)
(Oh, man, gotta concentrate! It’s all I can think about. I must be acting so natural right now!)
Wait. We’re not on trial here.
For flagrant truancy in the act of conspiring to do stuff. Bad stuff.
Oh, you must have me confused for someone else entirely.
Y’know, just some kid who goes to your high school and probably looks like me.
He sounds handsome, but it’s not me.
I’m some other guy entirely, a cool guy, who graduated last year.
Hmm. Well, there WERE students last year.
And some of them MUST have graduated…
Is it possible I started tailing the wrong person?!
You should probably leave that kid alone. He keeps busy enough with his good looks and immaculate fashion sense to have to worry about you guys following him around.
(But if there’s one thing I’ve learned, it’s that Namco High is full of surprises!)
(Uh...where did Richard get off too? It’s like he disappeared!)
(I can’t believe we risked even more detention on a wild goose chase!)
(Well, Richard won’t get caught, I guess. Where’d he get off to!)
Sitting there and thinking your thoughts won’t get you any less in trouble.
(Ah! There’s Richard! He’s hiding behind a crate.)
(No sense in getting both of us in trouble. Hmmm. Maybe acting natural will get me out of this jam!)
Nice try. You think you’re the first kid to pull the old “act natural” trick?
You’re about as natural as a tree!
Not on the Namco Moon! Which is where I was thinking of!
You didn’t know about that part of it.
Know about the moon, I mean. Because I’m sentencing you to EXTREME LUNAR DARK SIDE DETENTION!!!
It’s a project I’m working on. With Tomari.
Well. He’s building a rocket in his spare time and I have plans.
I guess you should take me away.
Because it’s not like there’s anyone else from Namco High here with me.
And that’s just what I’ll do!
